actions-list.header: On agreeing to the Pettersen amendment (A004) Roll Call 287
actions-list.actionItem: Recorded vote pending.
Pursuant to the provisions of H. Res. 524, the Committee of the Whole proceeded with 10 minutes of debate on the Pettersen amendment No. 4.

An amendment, offered by Ms. Pettersen,  numbered 4 printed in House Report 118-115 to prevent the legislation from being enacted if the FHFA Director determines that Sec. 2 would increase fees on middle class borrowers.
On agreeing to the Lee (NV) amendment; Agreed to by voice vote.
Pursuant to the provisions of H. Res. 524, the Committee of the Whole proceeded with 10 minutes of debate on the Lee (NV) amendment No. 3.

An amendment, offered by Ms. Lee (NV),  numbered 3 printed in Part B of House Report 118-115 to require that the GAO study assess the recalibrated single-family pricing framework's impact on affordable housing preservation, rural housing, and manufactured housing.
On agreeing to the Lee (NV) amendment; Agreed to by voice vote.
Pursuant to the provisions of H. Res. 524, the Committee of the Whole proceeded with 10 minutes of debate on the Lee (NV) amendment No. 2.

An amendment, offered by Ms. Lee (NV),  numbered 2 printed in Part B of House Report 118-115 to require that the GAO study assess the recalibrated single-family pricing frameworks impact on first-time, low-income homebuyers.
On agreeing to the Boebert amendment; Agreed to by voice vote.
Pursuant to the provisions of H. Res. 524, the Committee of the Whole proceeded with 10 minutes of debate on the Boebert amendment No. 1.
An amendment, offered by Mrs. Boebert,  numbered 1 printed in Part B of House Report 118-115 to require the GAO Study in Section 5 to also be made available to the public online.
The Committee of the Whole proceeded with one hour of general debate on H.R. 3564.
The Speaker designated the Honorable Dan Newhouse to act as Chairman of the Committee.
House resolved itself into the Committee of the Whole House on the state of the Union pursuant to H. Res. 524 and Rule XVIII.

Rule provides for consideration of H.R. 3564, H.R. 3799 and H. Res. 461. The resolution provides for consideration of H.R. 3564 under a structured rule with one hour of general debate; H.R. 3799 under a structured rule with eighty minutes of general debate; and H. Res. 461, under a closed rule with one hour of general debate. The resolution provides for a motion to recommit on H.R. 3564 and H.R. 3799.

Considered under the provisions of rule H. Res. 524. H.R. 3564 â€” "To cancel recent changes made by the Federal Housing Finance Agency to the up-front loan level pricing adjustments charged by Fannie Mae and Freddie Mac for guarantee of single-family mortgages, and for other purposes."
The House proceeded with one minute speeches, which by direction of the Chair, would be limited to 5 per side of the aisle.
The Chair designated Mr. Carl to lead the Members in reciting the Pledge of Allegiance to the Flag.
The Speaker announced approval of the Journal.  Pursuant to clause 1, rule I, the Journal stands approved.
Today's prayer was offered by Pastor David Bullock, Luke 4:18 Fellowship, Mobile, Alabama.
The House convened, starting a new legislative day.
